location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from J H Atkinson, British India Steam Navigation Company Steam Ship Euphrates, Bushire Roads to James Charles Edwards, Assistant Political Resident, Persian Gulf

physicalDescription.extent: This letter is an enclosure to the letter on folios 96-97.

mods.abstract: Letter enclosing the articles of agreement for crew members which is for Bombay to the Persian Gulf and back to Bombay for a period of not more than three months and informing Edwards that Goolam Ali [Ghulam 'Ali] has not been restrained and has been seen and questioned by the Residency moonshee [munshi].The letter goes on to discuss the runaway slaves who the Captain believes were on board at some time in Busreh [Basra] but that a thorough search of the vessel at Fao [Faw] did not find any trace of them and that he had telegraphed Mr Johnston, Vice-Consul at Busreh regarding the search at Fao and had attempted to satisfy the owner of the slaves that they were not on board the Euphrates.
